quillt 0.0.0.9000

quillt

Overview

quillt is a pkgdown template for packages in the R Markdown ecosystem. The goal of quillt is to create a patchwork quilt of all the packages that R Markdown users benefit from. That means packages that help users extend R Markdown using new output formats and templates, or that build upon existing packages to improve the quality of life for R Markdown users. If you feel that your package fits, please feel free to use this template for your own package.

The theme is built on top of the paper bootswatch theme.

Using quillt

Make sure your _pkgdown.yaml contains:

template:
  package: quillt

development:
  mode: auto

home:
  strip_header: false

You can customise the “part of” in the header and the footer text.

template:
  package: quillt
  params:
    part_of: rmarkdown.io
    footer: ...

To work properly, quillt requires the css files in inst/pkgdown/assets/. Because of this, you should not set default_assets: false in your _pkgdown.yaml.

template:
  package: quillt
  # Do not do this!
  default_assets: false

CSS files

Three CSS files play a role in styling the site:

  • tidyverse.css is generated from files in scss/ written by Robby Shaver. Generally you should not touch these files; Robby is the owner. If needed you can regenerate tidyverse.css by running this code:

    # devtools::install_github("rstudio/sass")
library(sass)
sass(
  sass_file("scss/tidyverse.scss"),
  output = "inst/pkgdown/assets/tidyverse.css",
  options = sass_options(output_style = "nested")
)

  • pkgdown.css comes from pkgdown.

quillt is built for R Markdown, an ecosystem of packages for creating computational documents in R. Learn more at rmarkdown.rstudio.com.

Developed by Alison Hill, Desirée De Leon. Site built with pkgdown.
